alert.note: Alert for Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 11:04PM CDT until May 20 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT FRIDAY FOR WESTERN WINONA COUNTY... At 1104 PM CDT, Emergency management reported some washed out roads in the warned area. There are also mudslides reported near Homer, south of Winona. Some additional rainfall is expected later tonight with amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch of rainfall possible. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winona, Goodview, St. Charles, Lewiston, Stockton, Rollingstone, Altura, Utica, Minnesota City, Elba, Bethany, Lazy D Campground and Whitewater State Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
